intro: Hecatonia alpestris, commonly known as the alpine hecatonia, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbrella-shaped inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, harsh climates. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hecatonia alpestris is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in alpine ecosystems.
